org.orgName: District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington

body.p: February 19, 1921.

OFFICIAL COPY furnished the Commissioner of Immigration, Ellis Island, N.Y.H., for his information.Conveyance of the alien to New York, N.Y., in connection with a party, will be deferred until definite arrangements have been made by your office for his return and sialing dates furnished the Commissioner of Immigration, Seattle, Wash. He is now serving a prison sentence and deportation will be deferred pending his release.
FOREIGN ADDRESS: State of Chortkoof (?) town of Noshkofanky (?), now Ukrainia.
EXACT COPY AS SIGNED BY ALFRED HAMPTON MAILED FEB 19 1921
Assistant Commissioner General
United States of America DEPARTMENT OF LABOR WASHINGTON
To FREDERICK, A. WALLIS, Commissioner of Immigration, Ellis Island. N.Y.H.
WHEREAS, from proofs submitted to me, after due hearing before Immigrant Inspector Thos. M. Fisher, held at McNeil Island, Wash.,
I have become satisfied that the alien Jack Matthews, or John Matthews, alias Yan Matsyeff,

who landed at the port of an unknown port, on the 31st day of August, 1919, has been found in the United States in violation of the Immigrant act of February 5, 1917, to wit:
That he has been sentenced, subsequent to the passage of said Act, to imprisonment for a term of one year or more because of conviction in this country of a crime involving moral turpitude committed within five years after his entry into the United States; and that he was a person likely to become a public charge at the time of his entry,
and may be deported in accordance therewith:
I Louis F. Post, Assistant Secretary of Labor, by virtue of the power and authority vested in me by the laws of the United States, I hereby command to return the said alien to Ukrainia to the country whence he came, at the expense of the appropriation "Expenses of Regulating Immigration, 1921." You are directed to purchase transportation for the alien from New York, N.Y., to his home in Ukrainia at the lowest available rate, payable from the above-named appropriation.
For so doing, this shall be your sufficient warrant. Witness my hand and seal this 19th day of February, 1921.
U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR BUREAU OF IMMIGRATION WASHINGTON
IN ANSWERING REFER TO NO. 54901/149
February 19, 1921.
Commissioner of Immigration, Seattle, Wash.
Sir:

The Bureau acknowledges the receipt of your letter of the 5th instant, No. 37012/500, transmitting record of hearing accorded the alien JACK MATTHEWS, or JOHN MATTHEWS, alias YAN HATVEYEFF, who entered at an unknown port, on August 31, 1919.

After a careful examination of the evidence submitted in this case, the Department is of opinion that the alien is in the United States in violation of law. You are therefore directed to cause him to be taken into custody and conveyed to New York, N.Y. for deportation, the expenses incident to such conveyance, including the employment of an attendant to assist in delivery, if necessary, at a nominal compensation of $1.00 and expenses in both ways, being authorized, payable from the appropriation "Expenses of Regulating Immigration 1921" Conveyance of the alien of New York, N.Y., in connection with a party should be deferred until definite arrangements have been made by the Ellis Island officer for his return and sailing dates furnished you by that office. Defer deportation pending his release from prison.
Respectfully Alfred Hampton Assistant Commissioner General.
February 11, 1921.
In re YAN MATVEYEFF. NO. 54904/149. Deportation is hereby directed for the charges in the warrant of arrest.
Louis F. Post Assistant Secretary
U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR Bureau of Immigration
WARRANT-IMMIGRATION
Pursuant to Departmental instructions the Bureau transmits herewith the case of YAN MATVEYEFF, alias JOHN or JACK MATTHEWS.
U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR IMMIGRATION SERVICE DISTRICT NO.16
IN REPLYING REFER TO NO. 37012/600.
DISTRICT HEADQUARTERS U.S. COMMISSIONER OF IMMIGRANT SEATTLE, WASH.
February 5th, 1921.
Commissioner-General of Immigration, Washington, D.C.

Referring to Bureau file No.54904/149, the case of YAN MATVEYEFF, alias JOHN (or JACK) MATTHEWS, for whose arrest the Assistant Secretary issued his warrant under date of November 15th, 1920, I transmit herewith the record of the hearing accorded the alien, who is now serving a sentence of one year in the United States Penitentiary, McNeil Island, Washington, for the crime of sending obscene matter through the mails. His sentence will expire, commitation considered, on April 4th, 1921.
The alien has not been represented by an Attorney.
Attention is requested to the summary and recommendation of the examining inspector, who recommends that the alien be ordered deported. I concur in this recommendation.

The alien's last entry was from Canada, but as he never became a citizen of that country and as he does not come wihtin the terms of the present reciprocal agreement between this Service and the Dominion Immigration Service, his return to Canada cannot be accomplished and I therefore recommend that the alien be ordered deported to Ukrauinia, the country of which he is now apparently a citizen.
John H. Sargent Acting Commissioner
